Letter to Louis L. McInnis from J. E. Edmond, July 18, 1885
Box 1 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 1 Folder 20 Louis L. McInnis Papers

en: A letter from J. E. Edmond of Kingsbury, Texas to Professor Louis L. McInnis dated July 18, 1885, expressing concern about the high tuition costs at McInnis's college relative to other educational institutions. Edmond compares the college's fees unfavorably to schools in England, Ireland, and Trinity College Dublin, arguing that he could send his son to Ireland for half the cost. The letter reflects 19th-century debates over agricultural education accessibility and state-aided versus private educational institutions in Texas.

Kingsbury. Texas
18 July 1885

Prof L L McInnis-

Sir
I am very much obliged for
your sending me Catalogue
of your College. When I wrote
the Honl Mr Pfeuffer I was
under the impression yours was
a State aided School and
that farmers like myself could
for a moderate sum get their
boys a good education but
my surprise was great to find
your terms were higher than
the first Class English or
Irish Schools where when
at home I could no more
